Instruction: Blend together eggs, cheese, parsley, 1 teaspoon salt, and pepper in a medium bowl until mixed. Cover and refrigerate while preparing the rice.
Stir in flour; mix until smooth and keep stirring for 2-3 minutes. Add milk and bring mixture to a boil, stirring constantly. Add cheese and season with salt and pepper; cook until thickened.
Shape rice mixture into balls, about 1 inch in size. Roll each ball in bread crumbs to coat evenly.
Fry rice balls until golden brown, about 5 minutes. Drain on paper towels. Serve warm with marinara sauce.
Fry rice balls in batches in hot oil, turning as needed for even browning. Drain on paper towels before serving warm.
